segments.text: I see the woman polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water pouring over the sink like a little waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is right in the puddle, and she doesn’t flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s always this focused or if today’s just an off day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are going to get into trouble, and she won’t even see it coming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I should say something, but I don’t want to startle her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water’s spreading fast, and the floor’s going to be a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just waiting to turn into chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
